main event: On October 18, 1958, the captain of the Dutch M.V. Goedkind reported a sighting of a very bright white object over the Atlantic Ocean.
interesting points: The object was initially mistaken for a shooting star but was later identified as a lighted object moving at 2 to 3 times the speed of a jet plane,It displayed a row of lighted portholes and a bright light in the center,The captain estimated the object's width to be about half a mile and its speed around 1000 to 1200 mph,The sighting lasted approximately 30 seconds,The report indicates the object was under perfect control and emitted a phosphorescent glow.
sighted object: very bright white light with lights like portholes
witness description: Captain Vries and the lookout on the Dutch M.V. Goedkind
